theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on aging-related decline in miRNA biogenesis machinery (Drosha, Dicer, Exportin-5) affecting miRNA levels and aging phenotypes.
Describes coordinated group disorganization of miRNAs during aging, implicating systemic dysregulation of miRNA expression networks.
Proposes miRNAs maintain biological robustness; aging involves loss of miRNA regulatory capacity and system stability.
Covers miRNAs as central regulators of multiple aging hallmarks, integrating miRNA dysregulation across pathways in aging.
Describes miRNAs as regulators of aging hallmarks and age-related diseases, emphasizing changes in miRNA profiles with age.
Focuses on miRNA regulation of phenotypic plasticity and its decline with aging due to miRNA dysregulation.
Describes miRNAs as stabilizers of gene regulatory networks buffering transcriptomic perturbations, with aging reducing this buffering capacity.
Focuses on miR-29 as a specific microRNA causally driving aging phenotypes via gene expression regulation.
Focuses on miR-305 as a specific microRNA modulating lifespan and aging-related pathways in Drosophila.
Focuses on let-7 microRNA regulating metabolism and lifespan with sex-specific effects.
Describes specific miRNAs (lin-4, mir-71, mir-239, mir-34) regulating lifespan via insulin signaling and DNA damage response.
Describes age-related de-repression of X-linked miRNA cluster targeting growth hormone signaling affecting lifespan.
Focuses on miR-80 regulating dietary restriction metabolic state and lifespan extension.
Proposes hypothalamus-pituitary secreted miRNA hormones as endocrine regulators of systemic aging processes.
Focuses on extracellular miRNAs mediating epigenetic regulation and systemic communication in metabolic memory and endothelial aging.
Describes miRNAs regulating proteostasis decline and protein aggregation in aging tissues, with systemic and tissue-specific effects.
Focuses on miRNAs regulating metabolic hallmarks of aging including nutrient sensing, mitochondrial function, and inflammation.
Describes miRNA regulation of chromatin remodelers affecting transcriptional programs and lifespan, modulated by dietary interventions.
Focuses on exercise-induced miRNA bursts modulating epigenetic memory and muscle metabolic adaptation during aging.
